O man where to start, damn huh... ok 
So the game is not perfect, like it has tons of bugs. But you can still have fun, if you dont get angry really quick. You can play killer or survivor, and you have moments when you just want to delete this game and say why why... the franky did i buy this game.I must say when you have some friends and play this game with them, its not that bad. If you have enough people 
(4-5) the costume is best option. The annoying thing is that you cant get all killers and survivors for game money, so you need to buy DLC packs, but we all know how the games works this days. If i must rate this game 7/10. The game is not perfect or amazing but its good.

Game is great, lots of fun. Reasonable to play in random groups and fun with friends.

ETA a year later:  NEVERMIND I WAS WRONG. I am suffering every time I play this game. It is for masochists who want to be angry all of the time and no one else. Toxicity at every turn, and it is ruining my life. Save yourself

I really enjoy this game, I think the overall dynamic of it os interesting enough to continue playing for quite a while. That being said, the game feels like a free to play game with the intent to have you purchase DLC and cosmetics, but it's not free. Even more important many of the best perks are tied to DLC characters, fo if you want to do well on the leaderboard then you need to buy other killers, like a hand full of them, on top of paying for the game. There is also no way to test out the killers or characters before you buy them, so if you spend the money on a killer and find out that they are not very interesting or fun to play then you're SOL.

Online matches in this game are very fun! It is honestly very infrequent that I run into toxic survivors or killers, I've even had several times wherein the killer will sweep the rest of the team and then help me find the hatch as long as I'm being a good sport, so we can both farm blood-points.

My last gripe is that I feel like one needs an encyclopedia to navigate the different items, terms, collectables, pips(?), status effects, etc. There has been multiple times wherein I have had to look up how an item or perk actually works. With a name like "Exposed" you would think that you are exposed, visable, open, but it actually means that you take double damage. Just having a small window that destribes effects when you hover over them would be nice. It's mostly QOL stuff.
